intro: Dichapetalum lolo, commonly known as the Lolo mallow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, which are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural gardens.
